intro: Jurinella chamaecynara, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and has a low, spreading habit with hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the base of the plant, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Jurinella chamaecynara is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade conditions.
